Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for LAX”
Reviews.Author: Mira G
Reviews.Content: There was a problem when we stood in front of the airport and had to wait more than hour. It seems that there was some kind of communication problem between the hotel staff and the shuttle driver, who knows... But the hotel is pretty good for the price. If you keep an eye on your budget and you have a car this is the good option. It's very close to Venice beach (by car).

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy”
Reviews.Author: FrankG1955
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews - too noisy to sleep until the flights stopped and then a very early alrm call as they resumed. Also very basic room which is in drastic need of renovation. My first experience of Super 8 - (but unfortunately my second occurred a couple of days later - I'd booked through Hotwire so couldn't cancel after the first negative experience - last time I use them too as the prices aren't that much lower and they are totally inflexible re changes to plans.

Reviews.Title: “Good if your just sleeping at night”
Reviews.Author: SaraB73
Reviews.Content: I wanted something close the LAX because I landed at noon and flew out the next day at 11pm. I tried to take a nap at some point in the first day I was there, but was impossible. The airplanes literally sounded like they were going to hit the room every time they flew over. I expected this being a airport hotel, but just wanted to warn anybody else that had a night flight like me, do no expect any sleep outside of midnight to 6am. They fly that late and start that early. The bed was clean, I found check in to be very friendly. The Greek restaurant that is next door was very friendly but the food was not that good, and it was over priced. Check out was fast, but not very friendly. I had no issues with the shuttle picking me up at noon or driving me back at 9pm. Both drivers were friendly. Internet is free but very slow. The only thing I would note is if you don't have a cell phone, I found phoning the shuttle impossible. I read that there are phones located in the airport to call the hotel, but no one knew where, and someone working there called the hotel for me on their cell phone. Also, no elevators, so taking your luggage up to the second level is a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Shuttle?”
Reviews.Author: muskrat2
Reviews.Content: As explained by hotel management a few reviews back, most hotels near LAX use the same shuttle service. It seems, however, some use it more then others. We called for shuttle pick-up around 11:15 PM. Over an hour later (and two more calls) the shuttle arrived. During this wait we saw shuttles for other hotels go by numerous times. The shuttle for the Renaissance/Crown Plaza (mentioned later) went by at least three times. The next day, our over seas flight did not leave until late evening. When we checked out, we were informed that the last shuttle left at 12 noon because that was their check out time. The guy at the front desk suggested that we could (if we were not afraid) walk three blocks to the Renaissance and use theirs. They did allow us to store our luggage, so at 5:30 PM we hauled our luggage down to the Renaissance and stowed away on their shuttle. The internet to print a boarding pass was not free--$ 5 minimum. On the plus side-the room was small, but clean and passed the bed bug inspection.

Reviews.Title: “Super 8 LAX ... Not A Problem”
Reviews.Author: ericthelot
Reviews.Content: We arrived evening into LAX from a 14 hour flight. Rang the hotel for shuttle pickup , which they advised we would be picked up in 15 minutes , which we were. Reception was friendly and quick. Our room (206) was clean and tidy, bed & bathroom were fine, also the free WiFi was handy. We had to fly out the next day so early to bed. Breakfast in the morning was continental style and all that one needed to start the day. , checkout was friendly and quick. Promptly at 8, our free shuttle arrived to take us back to LAX. Super 8 LAX is a great budget airport hotel, and doesn't pretend to be anything more than that, as the name suggests you are near the airport so there is aircraft flying near by, which we personally didn't mind. We wouldn't have any problem staying here again or recommending it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “great value, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: briarbeard
Reviews.Content: Moving to Asia from Missouri with our two small children. We broke up the trip with an overnight in LA before embarking on the long flight. I was glad we stayed here, as this met all our needs. With AAA booking directly on their site is a great value. Had a room with two queen beds. Clean. The room was bigger than many we've stayed in - even had a couch, which was perfect for last minute Skype calls and re-arranging luggage. Internet worked really well and was free. Breakfast was standard Super 8, basic cereals and muffins with beverages. Seating area was open all the time as it's part of the check-in area. This was great for us, as I have food sensitivities. This allowed me to fix my own dinner/lunch with the microwave. The rest of the family ordered food from a restaurant that delivered, which was very convenient. We made use of their coin laundry. We enjoyed the courtyard/parking lot area which felt very safe and allowed our kids to run off some steam. At the airport, the station where you are supposed to be able to call the hotels for shuttle service was out of order (this is not the hotel's fault). We had Super 8's phone number, so we called with our cell phone. It should be noted that a phone call needs to be placed in order to get the shuttle service. We waited about 15 minutes after placing our call, and the shuttle had plenty of room for our massive amount of luggage. Returned to airport the next day by shuttle that left on the hour. The drivers were very helpful and friendly and helped us with all the bags. Shuttles are free + tip for driver's help with luggage. Only potential drawback is that if you are a sensitive sleeper, the planes are pretty loud. We were exhausted so it didn't bother us a bit. We couldn't hear anything from the neighboring rooms or outside, other than the planes. Perhaps ear plugs would do the trick. :) Also, at one time hot water ran out fairly quickly. About one hour later it was back in full force.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't even pick me up at the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Loren W
Reviews.Content: Never got to stay at this hotel. they had to many issues picking up from airport like a no show shuttle. i stood there for 1 and1/2hrs and only saw one shuttle which passed me up because of traffic which i of course don't blame them for, but after that not a single shuttle. there was a guy timing shuttles he tried to get the shuttle and couldn't. so i slept in LAX airport. never going attempt to stay here again. be aware of this if u need the shuttle to pick u up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: nancy_siesta_key
Reviews.Content: For a no frills hotel, this is a great choice. It was convenient to the airport, the shuttle driver was friendly and extremely helpful, and the Greek restaurant attached to the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant stay at a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: depechegirl02
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel room for a 1 night stay in the LAX area & after reading the reviews on this site, I decided to book a room at this hotel. I just needed a clean room to sleep in and that's exactly what I got. The room was quite spacious & clean, the free breakfast was good & not having to pay for parking was a plus as well. I could hear planes flying overhead but it wasn't to the point where I was inconvenienced by them. I definitely got my money's worth and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's an alight place”
Reviews.Author: Youngonetravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as we just wanted a few days in la and somewhere close to the airport, so this hotel served its purpose of somewhere to sleep at night whilst we were out exploring all day as we hired a car. It was cheap so weren't expecting to much to begin with, breakfast was included which was basic such as Danishes, toast cereal juice and tea and coffee which was good enough for me. I must say it isn't the best area but I didn't go walking around at night. Wifi is free but EXTREMELY slow and being so close to the airport it wasn't to loud.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, friendly and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: donandmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location Jan. 2, 2012. The room we were given had some problems with the power and we were promptly moved to another (even nicer room). The rooms are nicely renovated, clean and well equipped. If you are extra large you may have some difficulty fitting into a single stall shower. It is under a flight path and can be a little noisy, but inside the room it was relatively quiet. It is a little out of the way to find a restaurant but one can order in or walk a short distance to find somewhere to eat. For the price, it was well worth the stay and we will stay there once again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Rasika_Raghavan
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive but decent place to stay for a night in LA and this place served its purpose very well. Rooms were clean, bed was comfortable, and though the room was a bit small it was adequate. The bathroom was clean and well lit. The motel is opposite the airport so it is a bit noisy with the sounds of aircrafts landing and taking off. Parking was free so was a the continental breakfast. Breakfast was basic, there were no hot items. Company made muffins, cereals, and breads were the items, with coffee and juice. Check in and check out were smooth. If you need an inexpensive clean place to spend a night, and dont mind the noise of the airport, then this motel is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: steena18
Reviews.Content: Wow. I stayed at the Crowne Plaza prior to here and this place was 100% better!! The room was lovely and clean, free internet, free breakfast (great variety), cable tv (all channels), close to airport, free shuttle bus, value for money, late checkout & friendly staff. Overall, I would recommend this place to all and will be back there again next visit to LAX!

Reviews.Title: “Actually very good”
Reviews.Author: frank_czech
Reviews.Content: + close to the airport + safe and convenient location (close to car rentals, 7 Eleven just a block away) + clean + helpful staff + free shuttle (in the late hours it doesn't run much frequently, we had to call the motel up) + good breakfast (plenty of juice, coffee, muffins, bagels, cereals ...) + good price/performance - noise from airplanes flying over the building (however, the traffic in the night is not that busy) Conclusion: If you arrive late to the LA and are exhausted after hours spent in the plane, this motel is a very good choice. However, the noise caused by planes might be an issues (if you are a light sleeper)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad room, cheap but unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: binder-dundatt
Reviews.Content: Great rate, relatively clean room, right in the LAX approach alley. The shuttle service was prompt and started at 4:00 AM, even though the front desk people offered little or no advice. The desk people were horribly rude.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Radarz
Reviews.Content: What else can I say about this hotel that has not already been said. But I would say that this hotel is functional. It provides a bed, close to the airport, with reasonable facilities and its relatively clean. It is a bit tired, and would benefit from a bit of a tidy up, but what can you expect for the price. We did not find the noise unbearable but be aware that the aircraft coming into LAX do fly right over the roof and very low as they are on final approach to the airport for landing. So if you are a light sleeper and you need your sleep, I would not stay here, but if you are just using it as a stopover before heading off somewhere else it is ideal. The free shuttle will pick you up from the airport and drop you back again with little delay. The breakfast is adequate and staff helpful. Hire car places are all around the hotel, so getting a hire car is not a problem. There are several fast food places nearby for a quick meal, but we ate at Sizzlers which is about 10-15 mins walk away. This hotel is ideal for the budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, convenient, cheap”
Reviews.Author: cat2011_11
Reviews.Content: A good, clean motel with free shuttle to/from the airport and free breakfast. Just what you need for a stop over in LA. No frills and no fuss. Cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “...don't ask more”
Reviews.Author: MrGu
Reviews.Content: ...don't ask more by the hotel. The price is correct for the standar in Los Angeles, you are close to the airoport and consequence you have the fly's noise. Room are correct, but many people arrive late and leave early. The parking is free. The breackfast is basic. Forget the pool. The position is very close at all the rent car and you have a shuttle from the last.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and some nice extras!”
Reviews.Author: TropicalPlaces25
Reviews.Content: For the price that you pay it is definitely worth staying here. We stayed for one night as a stop-over on our travels as it is so close to the airport. We came in expecting very little as it was cheap but it actually offered a lot: - Free shuttle to and from the airport - Free wifi in the room - A nice Greek restaurant We were starving when we arrived & as it was late didn't feel like going out so spotting the on-site Greek restaurant was a God send. I wouldn't say the food was fantastic but it definitely filled us up ;) My only complaint would be that the carpet in the rooms seemed a little rank so I tended to wear my flip flops when I was in the room. All these guys need to do is strip up the carpet and put down wooden floors and it would be just perfect! In summary this is perfect for a stop-over or 2 nights but I wouldn't spend my whole vacation here. P.S: You can really hear all of the flights taking off and landing so light sleepers be aware!

Reviews.Title: “A really convenient no-frills stop-over”
Reviews.Author: StefRich
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after flying in late before heading off into Arizona. It's very close to the airport and there are free shuttles but planes go over every few minutes with only a gap between 12 and 6 am. This does make sleep difficult but i's very handy for the airport so what more can you need? The greek restaurant over the side looks average but is very good!

Reviews.Title: “OK cheap acommodation”
Reviews.Author: l1eve
Reviews.Content: The last night of our 2 week road trip we booked a room in the Super 8 LAX; which was located right next to Herz, we were rented our car. The reception was ok; so were the rooms. There was a kind of anti mould product smell in the bathroom; although no mould visible. Room was spacious enough. Planes are flying over regularely until about 1am; and started again around 5am. Not a big issue, that's what you get when staying next to the airport. Isolation of the rooms could get better though. Breakfast was included. Don't expect too much, but it's nice to have a coffee in the morning. Price/quality was good. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay near the airport, this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Super8 lax”
Reviews.Author: fantlot
Reviews.Content: Good cheap accommodation all over America as I found out. No complaints about any of them . Clean tidy rooms and big. Nice free breakfast and free wifi. Would recommend them to anyone . Staff were also very helpful at every one I stayed in from LA to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great for convenience”
Reviews.Author: osusloopy21
Reviews.Content: The Super 8 was by far nicer than some other more expensive rooms I've stayed in. The customer service was great! The location was perfect. We only waited about 15 minutes for the airport shuttle arriving near midnight. The rental car places surround the hotel, which was super convenient. We had not prearranged a rental car till the next morning. It was nice to walk right across the street to pick up a car. The room in general was about what I expected. Not too fancy, but not shabby either. The bed was like a rock, but my husband seemed to enjoy it. The bathrooms were a surprise. It was nicer than I expected. All in all, I would stay here again if we needed a room close to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: juan171071
Reviews.Content: We had to change our room because of a terrible noise that, as they explained to us, came from a problem with the heating installation. They knew there was a problem, but gave us the room anyway. I must say that at least they offered a solution and I appreciate that. But the Motel is really old and the rooms smell terrible. I would not recommend this place at all. It was the worst motel we stayed in 15 days, and we slept in several cheap budget ones.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, simple breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nmdjackal
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Hotel exterior was dirty and I got really worried about the room condition. The staircase was full of insects and bad smells. You are going to hear planes taking off and landing but that wasn't a concern for me. Room: Room was really clean for a budget hotel. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was really clean too. Wifi: Wifi was free and the connection speed was acceptable. Breakfast: Breakfast was simple and fruit juice machine wasn't working during my stay. In-n-Out burger was 15 minutes walk away. Shuttle: I did not know that I was supposed to call the hotel for shuttle, waited for 30 minutes in the terminal. They also provide free shuttle back to the airport but make sure you tell the receptionist the time of your flight.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: arunkool
Reviews.Content: I stayed for about two weeks and I found the staff friendly and very helpful. The property is located well within the reach of all car rent cos and all tour operators buses come for daily tours. To start with the free shuttle service was very effective as they came within 10 mins after calling from airport.The continental breakfast is provided as part of the package which does its job. Only thing I found short of is that did not find any deli stores or super markets near by and only resturant you have nearby is Burger king right across the street. Other than thought everything looked good and staff were very friendly, so surely I will prefer to stay at this place again. Yes one thing you have to agree there will noice of aircrafts , but if you need to stay near the airport you have compromise on this aspect,nonetheless after 1 to 2 am i found the air craft traffic less .

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Pilgrim45900
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice place to stay if you have an early flight out of LAX. We had rented a car out of Avis and having the hotel right accross from the street made the drop off so easy. The hotel is not new, but very clean and convenient . Our television remote did not work at first. We contacted the office and they sent someone right away to check it out. The batteries were changed and everything worked great. The only negative is that there are occasional low flying planes, which did not bother us, but if you are a light sleeper there might be a problem. With the location and the Wyndham reward points it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Urine smell in the AC”
Reviews.Author: HeavyTravels
Reviews.Content: Was placed in the front part of the hotel which is extremely noisy from the street noise. So to cover up the noise I turned on the fan of the AC unit to mask the noise. Whoa...urine smell galore. Found another solution, I turned on the bathroom fan and left the door open just a crack. The white noise from the fan worked like a charm however I am sure they won't appreciate the electric bill next month.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: cmonsoboss
Reviews.Content: long story short. my bf visited me in bermuda dunes, goes to school in germany. so we NEEDED to make sure we got him to his flight on time, and we werent . this super 8 is literally a 15 min drive from LAX. we booked it 3 hours before arrival for $80 (1pm check-3pm checkout). it was clean, nice stand-in shower, marble countertop, plenty on table space, and we were a smoking room. it was quiet, and difficult to hear between rooms. only downer was the vending machine was broken, but theres a 7eleven 5 minutes away too. and most food places in the area (via grubhub) were free delivery. spent like $75 each of us. nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Night”
Reviews.Author: jrleeper
Reviews.Content: The reason I chose this place was the price, free parking, free airport shuttle. It also had cable and free wi-fi. We stayed here for one night as my son had a flight first thing the following morning. This is a no-frills place and definitely needed some cosmetic upkeep, but overall it was fine for what we needed and for the price as we didn't arrive until 8:00 at night. We basically needed a place to put our heads down. It's so close to the airport that the planes have their landing gear down as they're flying over. We were on the bottom floor so the planes did not affect our sleep. There were vending machines outside as well as an ice maker. I cannot comment on the pool or continental breakfast and I did not utilize them. I thought that the staff was very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: EmmaBelgium
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first and the last night of our USA-trip because of its great location to the airport. We rented a car with Avis and the hotel was right across the Avis parking lot. Very convenient! We stayed in 2 different rooms and they were both VERY clean, there were NO BEDBUGS, good shower, lots of TV channels and the private parkingspace is very usefull. We used the shuttle service on our last day and he was right on time. We arrived at our terminal in about 15 min. You hear the airplanes, altough at night there are hardly any and I was never awaken by them. The breakfast (included in the price) was very basic, but I guess it was good enough if you consider how cheap this hotel is.To me, this is the perfect location for a one night stay when you arrive in/leave LA. If I ever go back to LA, this will be my first night stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient”
Reviews.Author: AngelenePenguin
Reviews.Content: I arrived at LAX quite late and called Super 8 for a room and a shuttle service. The shuttle pick up was unclear and I had to wait quite a while for it. The outside of the motel looks dodgy as it is situated on a main road but my room was impeccably clean and I had one of the best nights sleep ever. My room was spacious, the shower hot and the breakfast was simple but it did it's job. The heater and air conditioner worked well and the television had a lot of stations. The staff were lovely as they helped me navigate my way around town by giving me a map. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ktown_traveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night as I had an early flight to catch the next morning. Close in proximity to LAX. Rooms were huge, clean and comfortable, and a great price to boot. Breakfast was dissapointing, but I would recommened this property for an overnight stay...

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay - friendly staff, no issues, definitely recommend for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: florida_snowboarder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Super 8 location on my first trip to Los Angeles back in 2004, and rebooked for January 21-23, 2011 after deciding to take a last-minute surf holiday. I was able to find a highly discounted rate on priceline for $52.00 per night, which was excellent considering it was a weekend. As the Super 8 is a value chain, of course one can't go there expecting the Ritz-Carlton! With that being said, the staff were great from start to finish, very nice people. Before even completing my request for a cab company number, they were on the phone calling for me. Great customer service! This location has a free shuttle service to and from LAX. They can be contacted at any of the courtesy phone touch-screen kiosks that are located in just about every baggage claim area. You are patched directly to the front desk, they'll waste no time answering, will tell you exactly where to wait, and the shuttle will arrive quickly. On this particular visit, I stayed in room 230, and everything was in excellent shape. The only thing I noticed was that the king bed was actually two twins that were pushed together, but I didn't realize this until it was time to check out so obviously didn't have any issues. The room was located overlooking the courtyard, which was a lot quieter that the room on the parking lot side I had on my last visit. Free wifi is always a big plus, and the Greek restaurant at the rear of the property is awesome - Aliki's Greek Taverna. The property has a pool, free coffee/tea, and complimentary cereals and toast, although I didn't utilize any of these amenities. The ice machine in the parking lot was in great working order and could only be turned on by inserting a room key. As some other reviewers have mentioned, yes, airplane noise will be heard. I've talked to lots of friends that have stayed in just about every hotel in the LAX airport area, as far as 8 miles down the road from the terminals, and this is not a problem that's unique with just the Super 8, you'll get it anywhere. If noise is an issue, book miles away from the airport. I was having a hard time finding locations of nearby stores and restaurants within walking distance before my trip, and this area is generally nothing but hotels and rental car agencies, so here's what's around: Burger King is on Airport Blvd. about a block and a half away, on the opposite side of the road. It's visible from the front of the property. 7 Eleven is up the road in the other direction, on the corner of Airport Blvd. and Manchester Ave. Walking down Westchester will take you directly into an area of Sepulveda Blvd. which has In N Out Burger, Ralph's Supermarket, Boston Market, Pizza Hut, and many others. Great stay. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great (Clean) Place, Centrally Located, Excellent Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Ex_Calibur_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: It was a clean hotel where we weren't initially planning to spend three days but later on seeing the service and cleanliness of the place, we ended up sticking to it. Near the Airport, great Tours of the City available from here; must try to travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: jsandz
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with a few friends at the end of our Los Angeles trip and were completely satisfied. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The property is well cared for and the rooms were clean and comfortable. We were able to schedule a guided tour of Los Angeles/Hollywood easily at the front desk and the bus picks you up right at the driveway! We noticed the planes landing upon check-in, however, once in our rooms it was unnoticeable. Great price, great location. Will definitely come back in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for a needed layover”
Reviews.Author: ggintruckee
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel on trip advisor and felt it was a good value for what it was...a needed layover for some sleep between flights. The rooms were dated but clean and comfortable. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 pm and there were still plenty of planes flying over so it was a bit noisy. We were tried after a long day and it didn't take long to fall asleep and ignor the planes, if you are a light sleeper you may not be as lucky. The breakfast was one of the poorer continental breakfasts that we have had in a long time, but we had a quick bite and we were on our way. Free shuttle and Wi-fi was a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Functional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelisgood4u
Reviews.Content: As the title says, it's a nice functional motel, close to LAX. There is a free shuttle service from/to the airport, and you call the motel once you leave the luggage area. It's a not a new facility, but I found a clean room, where I was not bothered by airplane noises (as some reviewers have complained). The bathroom was clean, which is plus. The breakfast is nothing to write home about, and there are no major eating places close by, so that's something you have to consider if you are planning to stay there for long time periods; I was only there for one night. The motel is next to car rental offices, and felt safe to me during a day walk, but I did not do anywhere during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good, inexpensive place for the night”
Reviews.Author: sydney59602
Reviews.Content: When I made my reservation, I found the reservation person friendly. He answered all my questions about the shuttle, motel, distance to the airport, reservation and cancellation policy, and so on. I reserved a room for one night. When I got into LAX, it was late at night. I called the hotel and they told me where to go to wait for the shuttle and sent it to pick me up. It took about 30 minutes for it to get there since it had to drop someone off at another terminal first. When I got to the hotel, the desk person was friendly and professional. I stayed in a room on the second floor in the building that is set back from the road and was not bothered by noise. My room was clean and had everything I needed for a one-night stay. The bed was clean and very comfortable; the bathroom was clean and stocked with towels, soaps, shampoo, lotion, etc., coffee maker and coffee; and the AC worked. There was a tv, but I didn't turn it on so I don't know if it worked or not. There was no mini refrigerator. When I went to the office in the morning, there was a modest continental breakfast of cereal, muffins, toast, coffee, tea, and juice. The hotel shuttle to LAX stops out front every half hour so I was able to catch it after I checked out. I noticed that there is a small pool in the courtyard area, too. The staff and shuttle driver were friendly and helpful. All in all, I found this to be a very reasonably priced place to stay. If you have a limited budget or just want a place to sleep and aren't looking for something extravagant, it is a good choice. I am always glad when I can spend under $80 for a room for the night, and it turns out to be a clean, comfortable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and internet for my teenaged daughter”
Reviews.Author: altheajean1954
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost walking distance from the airport. The staff was very courteous and helpful. My room was clean and my teen aged daughter LOVED the fact that high speed internet was excellent. We only stayed one night as we were waiting for other family members to arrive in LA. The only complainant that I have is that I called for a ride from the airline and the "Blue Van" never showed up after me calling twice! We ended up hitching a ride from another hotel van that was going our way!

Reviews.Title: “Immerse yourself in the whole flying experience.”
Reviews.Author: Owlgirl54
Reviews.Content: Super8 LAX is, to say the least, an interesting place to stay. My husband and I spent 2 nights there recently and enjoyed the stay very much. We needed a place to veg out after flying from NY and San Fran and awaiting our return flight to Australia. Luckily we both enjoy plane spotting as you could see and hear them for most of the day. The noise dimmed after 10pm ensuring a good nights sleep. The office staff were eficient and helpful directing us to the nearby local bus terminal and giving easy instructions on how to use the Metro subway as well. We enjoyed walking to a Denny's restaurant for a meal and observing life in the outer suburbs on our walk home. The free breakfast and 24hr tea/coffee were a nice bonus. Several cereals, toasts, english muffins and juice were on offer. Enough to stop the worms from biting before we headed out for the day. Transfers to and from the airport were convenient and efficient. Whilst this is not the most salubrious of hotels, it is clean comfortable and reasonably priced. It suited our needs well.

Reviews.Title: “Motel says it all ......”
Reviews.Author: acoya
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a really cheap place to stay, don't care about cleanliness or mind the airplanes flying over your room every 2 minutes .... then this is the place for you! Staff at the front desk where somewhat friendly. The lady that checked us in was not! She seemed annoyed & was very rude when I asked if my friend & I could get a room with 2 Queen beds. When I tried to explain to her that we booked a room with 2 Queen beds I was interrupted, snapped at & had to pay an additional fee. Room was a fair size for what we payed. The bathroom was not very clean. There was dust all over the coffee maker & bathroom screen, which were never cleaned during our stay. The shower is made for people that are 5'0 & under ... both of us had to crouch down to get our hair under the shower head. We were often woken up in the middle of the night to people fighting & screaming at each other in their rooms/parking lot. Kinda felt like we were in a bad neighborhood at times. They have a Greek restaurant on site that looked very run down and when I asked one of the staff at the front desk if it was any good, I was told right away that it wasn't a good place to eat! They have a small swimming pool on site with chairs & tables. Pool was clean & well kept up! Personally I would never stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected and a little more”
Reviews.Author: AndyAA
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle from LAX was great and once I worked out were the pickup was the Driver arrived. Friendly staff checked me in and even though the planes overhead were loud and annoying to begin with I slept like a baby till morning. Big TV, clean bathroom and comfy bed. In the morning I used the free taxi phone to call a taxi which came within minutes!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: mquintana
Reviews.Content: Extremely noisy location. By main road, with constant traffic throughout the night. To make things worse, the water pipes kept on making a torturing noise ALL night.. could hardly sleep. Staff not very friendly, did not have knifes for spreading the margarine or butter (only choice just about) on the toasts. Stay away if you can..

Reviews.Title: “If you want no sleep, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Lorica83
Reviews.Content: -the planes are flying over this motel constantly and it feels like they are right above your head - we got absolutely NO sleep here -it's close to the airport which I guess is convenient if you are flying into LA really late but I feel you're better off driving a little further for a good night's sleep. -this place is cheap but not cheap enough considering the noise -free parking -crappy continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladydi6
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights and had absolutely no complaints. This was our 3rd or 4th stay. The entire staff went out of their way to be pleasant and helpful. Free shuttle to and from the airport, free breakfast (good coffee). Pool, vending machines and a nice Greek restaurant next door! We come to LAX for the LA Jazz Institute 2X per year and the staff at Super 8 are the same people (Jan, Jim, Harry and Sam). They make us feel like family.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Super_Road_Runner
Reviews.Content: This hotel, the service of people who work here are super friendly, clean rooms, is near the airport, free breakfast, free internet as well, free parking, free ice, has laundry, Etc. I was always looking for the 4 stars, which charge for everything (Internet, Parking, Breakfast, airport ride etc) but this hotel has changed my idea of Super 8. I recommend it. Enjoy your stay /

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Max320
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations, convenient location close to the Beach, LAX, bus terminal and the Mall!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: woolnough04
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night on the 20th april 2010 after arriving from australia.Planes didn't bother us to much,staff were great."no bed bugs".No problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for before or after flying”
Reviews.Author: amp-qld
Reviews.Content: This motel is good for before or after a flight. It's served by free shuttles and is near the local bus terminal for access to Los Angeles itself. The rooms and breakfast are fairly ordinary but adequate for the price. We didn't have any trouble with aircraft noise. There's an excellent Greek restaurant just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: Allen60
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location and competitive price. Walkable to restaurants, rental car agencies, and post office. Great place if you return a rental car at Avis or Hertz-you can walk to hotel and take shuttle to LAX. Downsides is the flight path is above hotel and breakfast is a waste of time. Cereal and toast. Will stay here again-no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Ticket!”
Reviews.Author: PedroPerth
Reviews.Content: I decided to break up the long trip from Perth, Australia to New York City with a nights stop over at LAX to rest up. So glad I did too as my flight was delayed 4 hours and those passengers with tight connections missed them. All I had to do was ring the motel from the free phone at the arrival lounge then wait for their free little shuttle bus to come & pick me up. Most cool after a really long flight. Not much around the motel so I used the munchie machines outside in the carpark heaps (coke, chips, chocolate bars) and also walked down to Burger King about 10 minutes away. The next morning the shuttle bus dropped me back at my departure terminal (10 minute ride). Just brilliant. Great value motel and so worth it for those travelling long distances and needing to rest and not wanting the stress of having to make a same day connection and waiting aorund for that, There was also a free breakfast type thing at reception while waiting for the shuttle bus which the Americans knew what it was and what to do but I did not. I got myself a coffee and left it at that.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most comfortable accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: krbPalmDesert_CA
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over Christmas. Reviewers are right that the staff is pleasant. Breakfast was simply dry cereal (fruit loops anyone?) and a few not so great pastries. My main complaint was the bedding. Our king-size bed had a queen size sheet on the bottom and a twin-size sheet laid cross-wise, so sleeping tangled in the sheets was not conducive to a restful night. The planes land right across the motel, but noise stopped after about 9:00 pm and did not start up again until 5:30 am. I don't think we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 1 night before flight”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Eld
Reviews.Content: Dropped off car at Avis, picked up some beer en-route at a garage and headed to motel(10 minute walk). Found the 'Welcome to Inglewood' sign on the way back, but the motel is nowhere particularly dodgy. There is a Greek place to eat next door which was ok, but they dont sell beer. The food was cheap and at least you could sit in. Otherwise you'd be going to one of the chains for a burger.

Reviews.Title: “Could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorCool
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. I got my rental car from the airport and it was right around the corner! The rooms are clean enough but the bathroom could definitely use some updating with the small sink and tiny shower stall. And the tile on the shower floor looks dirty so bring shower shoes. Also, the parking lot gets full quickly but there is plenty of parking on the street on the side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great price. Clean room. Nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: HalfMarathonGirl
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant 4 day stay at this inexpensive, very clean hotel. The staff (front desk and housekeeping) was helpful and kind. The room was clean (bed & bathroom). The parking area was small but free and not a problem getting in and out. The free breakfast was simple but adequate with cereals, pastries, juices, milk and coffee. There was a coffee maker and hair dryer in the room. I live in rural Ohio and did not feel the area was unsafe in anyway. Our car rental company was a block away and my friend and I (2 middle-aged women) felt comfortable walking back in the late evening to our room from dropping our car off. The hotel had free 24 hour airport transportation. There was one Greek restaurant in the same block of the hotel (that we did not try). Otherwise, there were no other eateries we noticed within walking distance. We did not notice the airplane noise at night but we ran the fan which may have muffled the sounds. There was an outside pool that we did not have time to enjoy but it looked clean. If I ever have to travel to LA again and fly into LAX, I will probably stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: guilheb
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills hotel located near the LAX airport. They provide a free shuttle from the airport. The room was what you would expect from a Super 8, no more, no less. But it's not in the greatest location, there aren't any restaurant or anything going on around the hotel. People have mentionned that it's a bad neighborhood, but we didn't see anyone on the street... no danger there! Fortunately for us, the car rental agency was right accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Old style Motel, But reasonabel value”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
Reviews.Content: Basic S8 breakfats. Good shuttle from airport, Rooms are dated, bathroom small (showerhead is good if you are 4 feet tall), walls are thin with people leaving and arriving at all hours with airport nearby, BUT for a one night stay it is reasonable. Greek Restaurant attached passable for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Motel, Awful area, Avoid”
Reviews.Author: lindapinda
Reviews.Content: We booked this for one night before flying. The area was so bad we had to put a chair behind the door in case anyone tried to get in! Gangsters pulling up in the carpark all night with ghetto blasters at full pelt. My husband went out to get a pizza and was accosted by hookers. We stayed in the room all night as we were scared to go out. Would avoid it at all costs and pay a bit more to be safe. The motel even charged our credit card twice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: esco_lets_go
Reviews.Content: My flight was cancelled from LAX to LAS, due to snow storm in Vegas. It can be very stressful to be dialing numbers in the wee hours in the morning to wake up a friend or relative to pick you up, because the next flight wont depart for 20 hours. Eventually, if nothing works out, you give in, Super 8 Motel. You just need to rest, you didn't have planned to stay in LA. This motel is your safety nest. a shuttle will gladly pick you up at the airport, really. The staff will work with you to ensure your stay is comfortable. I was glad to find this motel was pretty neat. Planes will be kinda disturbing, and the room might not be well maintained. But the Wi-Fi, cable, shuttle, continental breakfast, comfort and price all make this a wonderful unexpected stay. Stress gone. $69 bucks, GREAT BUY. Also, if you did want to visit Los Angeles and its many attractions, restaurants and all that, I would recommend it. Your going to be out of your room for most of your stay, and why not save some bucks. Very convenient to get to Disneyland, and other attractions/resturants/beaches and all that.

Reviews.Title: “Flight path”
Reviews.Author: aussie2008
Reviews.Content: The motel was convenient to LAX had the rooms were good for the price. However, the motel is right under the flight path for planes landing at LAX (ie. the runway starts just across the road) so it can be very noisy. They supposedly had a curfew but we heard planes after curfew had started. The hotel staff gave us a room on the lower floor which did provide some sort of noise buffer. If you're a deep sleeper or you have ear plugs this motel is good for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “super price for super clean!”
Reviews.Author: Morisniknam
Reviews.Content: My two "PICKY" daughters and I stayed five nights at this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised the cleaniness of the hotel. Very cosy room, super -clean bathroom. A little noisy because of the proximity to LAX, but it was SO COOL to look at the planes landing!!!! Breakfast was ok, but they could have more variety of muffins! On-time scheduling for the airport pick ups and drop offs. I would highly recommend this hotel if you like to save money and stay in a nice hotel. I will be back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an airport location”
Reviews.Author: eandtonthemove
Reviews.Content: We chose the Super 8 primarily for the cost and airport location - and were glad with our choice. From using the bank of 'hotel phones' at the airport to reserve a room and then arriving at the hotel, took only about 45mins. We were pleasantly surprised with our room here - spotlessly clean, huge bed plus free and speedy WIFI. Not many places to wander to if you're hungry, but the usual food places do deliver to your room. If you're on a budget and need somewhere close to the airport - we'd recommend the Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good value”
Reviews.Author: Ingrid T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is still a good value despite being $21 more than it was when I stayed there a year ago ($76 with corporate discount, up from $55). They have renovated the rooms which probably accounts for the price increase. The rooms are spotless as ever and everything looked very nice and new. The hotel is of course very close to the airport so there are lots of planes overhead during the day but it dies down late at night so sleeping is not a problem. The hotel appears to be family-run and I have to say the staff is a bit rude.

Reviews.Title: “for an overnighter it does the trick”
Reviews.Author: Aussnowboarder
Reviews.Content: Nothing flash but if you need to be close to the airport, for the price this motel will do the job. It's simple but convenient. And if you need to bus anywhere in LAX on the local buses, this motel is really close to the bus transit centre.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some work”
Reviews.Author: GreatNorthTraveler
Reviews.Content: Being almost directly at the start of the LAX runway we quickly noticed that the rooms were not sound proof... so the aircraft noise was quite loud. We took it in stride and took some good pictures of the planes landing directly out the North window. Had to change rooms an hour after check in as small red ants were climbing on the walls in the bathroom, headboard and under the blankets on the king bed. Second rooms was not infested. At $58.50 USD plus taxes for a Saturday night , within blocks to LAX and steps to car rental returns it served the purpose for our early departure.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please take my advice and stay away from this awful motel. Unpleasent neigbourhood and even worse motel. The staff steal whatever you forget out in the open in your room (I lost a piece of jewelry) and when trying to get some help from the manager with this matter he told me to get lost! You will be much better of at any other place in the area, there are many options nearby, closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not one for the kids!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here for our last night in California through the very dodgy expedia. Arrived with 2 adults and 3 children but surprised that there was no rollaway bed available for us. In fact the desk advisor said they did not have a rollaway bed!!! Did not stay even though we checked in as only enough bed for 2 adults and 2 children. A detail that was not considered important enough for these guys. Also overpowering smell of insect killer always a bad sign. About expedia - tried to get a refund but the hotel are lying to them and expedia are not interested in refunding me. So "boo" to expedia! We checked into the much more professional Travelodge a couple of miles nearer LAX and were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good play to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kerkie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here after arriving around midnight at LAX. The staff was helpful and we had no problem getting the shuttle from the airport nor getting into our room. We were given a room very close to the office and it was an adequate, clean room. We felt safe during our overnight stay. We had to take a shuttle back to the airport in the morning to get our rental car and had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE! AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on last night in LA and it was a nightmare! Questionable area. Loud, woman screaming like she was being attacked at 1 am. I called office and got no answer & after trying 4 times I packed my things and went to check out and no one would come to the door to let me into office so I could check out. Finally after 15 minutes and repeated banging on door and ringing of bell person came to door. I told them about screaming and noise he said he didn't hear anything. Duh he later admitted he was sleeping in back of office. I checked out after being there for 3 hours due to the above. I called manager when I got home and was told that hookers go there and he couldn't be sure I wasn't there for that so even though I was from out of town and would provide airline tickets. Said no refund would be made. Room had no lock on window, the smoke alarm was hanging from ceiling with no battery in it. AVOID this at all costs. I would not even stay there for free-not worth the risk

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: RachelAustralia
Reviews.Content: We had a stop over in LA and stayed one night at this hotel. The rate was very reasonable and the room was big and clean. It was basic but everything worked. The staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel-large room”
Reviews.Author: cinmik89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on August 3 before our early flight out of LAX. Our room was fairly large and clean. The air conditioner was a bit on the noisy side as I had trouble sleeping; the 3 other members of my family did not. Frequent low planes did pass overhead during the day and evening although there was no problem noted with planes during the sleeping hours of the night. You need to sign up for the free shuttle in the lobby. The shuttle runs on the hour and could get filled up. The shuttle left promptly and was a very short drive to LAX. The room smelled like carpet cleaner when we first entered but disappeared or we got used to it after awhile. Towels were thin and not enough given. I asked for more since we used the pool (small but wonderful for my 10 & 14 year olds). I was told "if we have them" they would bring them by. About 45 minutes later, we were given 2 towels (I asked for 4). Places to hang the towels are lacking as well as electrical outlets in the event you need to recharge items. (bring a power strip to pretty much any hotel nowadays as that was one thing lacking in all 4 of the hotels we stayed in during our California trip!!!) The continental breakfast of coffee, orange juice and pastries (very fresh!!!!) were good.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: florida_snowboarder
Reviews.Content: Very close to the LAX Airport and very clean. Would definitely visit again.

HotelInfo.Name: Super 8 Los Angeles Airport/LAX
HotelInfo.Address: 9250 Airport Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90045
